metadata.Title: CVE-2019-3564 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Go Facebook Thrift servers would not error upon receiving messages with containers of fields of unknown type. As a result, malicious clients could send short messages which would take a long time for the server to parse, potentially leading to denial of service. This issue affects Facebook Thrift prior to v2019.03.04.00.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-3564` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libthrift-0.13.0 - 0.13.0-2build2
libthrift-c-glib0 - 0.13.0-2build2
libthrift-perl - 0.13.0-2build2
php-thrift - 0.13.0-2build2
python3-thrift - 0.13.0-2build2
thrift-compiler - 0.13.0-2build2
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> it seems that this issue affected the go library in Apache Thrift as well. golang-github-uber-go-tally has an embedded copy of apache thrift

criterions.comment: thrift package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.13.0-2build2').
